result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan T Hackney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 188 days credit applied if imposed.  Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution in the amount of $250.00 to be paid for Stone Creek Coffee and $386.43 for Selective Insurance.  To be paid as a condition of probation.  Restitution to be paid before costs and fines.
01/18/2019 RESTITUITON AMOUNTS CORRECTED.
Cost to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed/sign releases.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  DNA Sample to be provided if not yet previously done.  No contact with Stone Creek Coffee in Delafield or any victim/witnesses listed in criminal complaint.  Maintain stable residence.  No use or possession of any dangerous weapon.
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Day Report Center 90 days good time not allowed on DRC.  If Defendant successfully completes Day Report Program, the 90 days jail stayed will be permanently stayed.

timeConds.notes: 180 days straight time - 1st 90 days with Day Report Center - LAST 90 days STAYED - to be used at agents discretion.

Defendant Ryan T Hackney in court, in custody, with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones.   Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Tom H. makes statements.Attorney Jones makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED & STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

11 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 188 days)
  -  6 YEARS  OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  5 YEARS  OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:   5 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sing releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with:  Stone Creek Coffee in Delafield or any victims/witnesses listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done
____Maintain stable residence
____No use or possession of any dangerous weapons

RESTITUTION:  $250.00 to Stone Creek Coffee and $386.43 to Selective Insurance (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

CONDITION TIME:  180 Days Straight Time - 1st 90 DAYS WITH DAY REPORT CENTER -  LAST 90 DAYS STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

DAY REPORT CENTER:  90 DAYS.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If Defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 90 days jail stayed will be permanently stayed.           

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Sentencing hearing on May 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ryan T Hackney in court, in custody, with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1. Repeater enhancer is stricken.  Attorney Jones requests a later sentencing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Jones requests an adjournment as he has not received discovery yet.  Speedy trial demand is waived/withdrawn by Defendant.    Bail remains as fixed. Motion to adjournment hearing. Filed by Atty Jones.
(Fax) Received on today's date, from Atty Jones to Judge Carter, requesting adjournment of 12/14/15 hearing.

Defendant Ryan T Hackney in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  City of Delafield Police Officer Steven Schrubbe sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Osborne.  Cross examination by Attorney Fragoso.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Defense objects and makes closing statements and requests to be heard on bail.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Fragoso requests a modification of bail.  State objects to a modification of bail.  The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND MADE TODAY.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing at 11-09-2015 03:00 pm
